title: Forklift Operator
summary:
We are currently seeking a skilled and reliable Forklift Operator to join our team in a cold storage environment. The successful candidate will play a key role in handling perishable food products, ensuring accurate and efficient movement, storage, and loading/unloading of goods.

Key Responsibilities:
Operate forklifts safely and efficiently in a chilled environment

Stack and unstack pallets with precision
Load and unload trucks as per delivery schedules
Build custom pallets to fit various items and orders
Maintain cleanliness and safety standards in the work area
Follow all company policies and cold room safety procedures
Requirements:

Valid forklift license and proven experience
Previous experience working in cold storage or with perishable goods preferred
Ability to build secure and stable pallets
Physically fit and able to work in a cold environment for extended periods
Attention to detail and good organizational skills
Reliable and punctual with a strong work ethic

title: Forklift Operator
summary:
We’re Hiring: High Reach Forklift Operators | Richlands 
Day Shift | Start ASAP | Ongoing Work

Join a nationally recognised company that’s growing like crazy! We’re on the lookout for skilled High Reach Forklift Operators to jump into an awesome team based at a state-of-the-art facility in Richlands.

 Shift: Monday to Friday, 5:30am – 1:36pm
 PPE Required: Hi-vis (vest or polo), steel caps – standard safety gear

 ✅ What You’ll Need:
- Current Forklift Licence
- At least 12 months' experience on High Reach (Jungheinrich or Yale experience is a bonus!)
- A good team vibe – you'll be working closely with others

✅ What You’ll Be Doing:
- Driving High Reach Forklifts (Jungheinrich & Yale)
- Picking and packing orders
- Loading containers for dispatch
- Working hand-in-hand with the Manufacturing team
- Being part of a tight-knit crew of 8

✅ Perks of the Job:
- Work in a modern, purpose-built warehouse
- Easy location in Richlands with plenty of free onsite parking
- Break room with free coffee machine, food vending machines & big screen TVs
- Designated smokers area

We’re screening now – don’t wait!
Reach out for a confidential chat and lock in your next opportunity.

title: Production Worker
summary:
Production Worker – Warehouse & Production | $31.60/hr | Acacia Ridge

Join a leading name in manufacturing and play a key role in keeping the supply chain moving.
Our client is a well-established leader in the manufacturing and production industry, exporting high-quality agricultural products across Australia and New Zealand. They're currently seeking a reliable and energetic Production Worker to support operations across both the production floor and warehouse.
This is a casual position with regular ongoing shifts, offering $31.60 per hour, located in Acacia Ridge, with the potential to grow your career in a thriving industry.

What You’ll Be Doing:
Hands-on work across production and warehouse functions
Picking, packing, and preparing goods for export
Operating within a fast-paced environment where accuracy and efficiency matter
Maintaining quality standards and following safety procedures
What We’re Looking For:
Solid experience in process or production work
Strong attention to detail – quality matters
A team player who’s proactive and dependable
Comfortable adapting to shifting priorities and tasks
Physically fit and ready to roll up your sleeves
Bonus Points If You Have:
Previous experience in manufacturing, warehouse, or similar environments
A can-do attitude and eagerness to learn
A track record of reliability and initiative
Why You’ll Love It:
Be part of a collaborative, close-knit team
Learn the ropes of a major industry player
Get paid well for your hard work
Build real experience that could lead to more down the track

title: Workshop Mechanic
summary:
Heavy Truck & Trailer Mechanic – Brisbane
Ready to put your mechanical skills to work with a supportive team and a well-maintained fleet? Join us as a Heavy Truck & Trailer Mechanic and enjoy a secure, rewarding role that values your craftsmanship and attention to detail.
 
The Role:
You’ll be responsible for maintaining and repairing a fleet of prime movers and trailing equipment to the highest standards. Reporting to the Workshop Manager, your day-to-day will include:

Completing preventive maintenance and repairs on fleet vehicles with pride and care.
Following Rentco service checklists and company policies.
Using your experience to support apprentices and foster a positive workshop culture.
Jumping in to assist with deliveries, housekeeping, and emergency breakdowns when needed.
Ensuring a safe, clean, and professional workspace.
What You’ll Bring:
✅ HR License
✅ Mechanical trade qualification
✅ Proven experience in fleet & trailer maintenance
✅ Familiarity with ABS/EBS diagnostic tools (advantageous)
✅ A commitment to safe practices and a proactive attitude
✅ Ability to pass a pre-employment medical and drug test
 
Perks & Benefits:

Competitive rates and industry-standard penalties
Secure, ongoing work with career growth opportunities
Modern workshop facilities and a well-maintained fleet
Annual incentive bonus of up to $3000
Supportive team culture that values your input and expertise
Want to learn more?
